events.text: Hello. We’ve got a bit of a problem out in the woods. Well, maybe problem is the wrong word.

Duck is exaggerating, it’s not exactly a problem. The winter mushrooms are booming right now, and it’s attracting a small herd of cows. This means that we need to collect the mushrooms fast, but it also raises the issue of what to do with the cows.

The way I see it, we have two options. Either we kill them, and preserve a lot of meat, or we keep them in the barn. Having enough meat would be good, but having cows may be a good long term investment.
Our stores aren’t what they need to be yet. Might be best to kill some of them.
Problem is, if we kill some of them, the other cows will scatter and won’t go to the barn with us. Cows have long memories, Raccoon. So it’s all or nothing.

events.question: What should we do with the cows, Frog?

events.text: We have to kill the cows. We need the meat and can’t afford to take care of the cows anyway.
I hate to say it, but you’re right. The village needs to eat.
We should save the cows. We can live off of their milk, and if we get desperate for meat, we can take a cow out of the barn once we have established their trust.
Good plan. I’m glad you said so, cause I’d hate to kill such majestic creatures.
